intro: Gomidesia pubescens var. casarettoana, commonly known as the Casaretto's pubescent gomidesia, is a rare and specialized plant species native to specific regions of southern Italy. It is characterized by its hairy, pubescent leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in the spring. The plant thrives in limestone-rich soils and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. Its botanical features include a compact growth habit and a unique floral morphology that distinguishes it from other members of the genus. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring careful conservation efforts.
